p: The cashew pulp juice extract (1 at 7.8 mg/mL) was tested against S. aureus planktonic cells and for the first time, against S. aureus biofilms where the cashew pulp juice extract was also tested in association with antimicrobials using the broth microdilution method and MBC. A MIC of 15.6 μg/mL, a MBC of 125 μg/mL and a biofilm Eradication Concentration of 500 μg/mL were obtained, demonstrating its antimicrobial and antibiofilm activity ( 79). The crude A. occidentale hydroalcoholic extract bark also showed good effects against S. aureus through disk diffusion (20 μL), presenting an inhibition halo of 11 mm ( 191).
